intro: Diplostephium parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaved diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its botanical structure supports its role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for various invertebrates.
